Song of Songs Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Song of Songs 1
  • Song of Songs 2
  • Song of Songs 3
  • Song of Songs 4
  • Song of Songs 5
  • Song of Songs 6
  • Song of Songs 7
  • Song of Songs 8
1 I am come into my garden, my brother, my bridegroom; I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk. Eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.   2 I sleep, but my heart waketh; Hark! my beloved knocketh: 'Open to me, my brother, my love, my dove, my undefiled; for my head is filled with dew, my locks with the drops of the night.' 3 I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them? 4 My beloved put in her hand by the hole of the door, and my heart was moved for her. 5 I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh, and my fingers with flowing myrrh, upon the handles of the bar. 6 I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had turned away, and was gone. My soul failed me when she spoke. I sought her, but I could not find her; I called her, but she gave me no answer. 7 The watchwomen that go about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my mantle from me. 8 'I adjure you, O sons of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, what will ye tell her? that I am love-sick.'
9 'What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among men? What is thy beloved more than another beloved, that thou dost so adjure us?' 10 'My beloved is white and ruddy, pre-eminent above ten thousand. 11 Her head is as the most fine gold, her locks are curled, and black as a raven. 12 Her eyes are like doves beside the water-brooks; washed with milk, and fitly set. 13 Her cheeks are as a bed of spices, as banks of sweet herbs; her lips are as lilies, dropping with flowing myrrh. 14 Her hands are as rods of gold set with beryl; her body is as polished ivory overlaid with sapphires. 15 Her legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold; her aspect is like Lebanon, excellent as the cedars. 16 Her mouth is most sweet; yea, she is altogether lovely. This is my beloved, and this is my friend, O sons of Jerusalem.'
